thread.title: Obama says he'll keep more troops in 'fragile' Afghanistan
thread.title_full: Obama says he'll keep more troops in 'fragile' Afghanistan - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Lolita C. Baldor and Julie Pace, Associated Press
title: Obama says he'll keep more troops in 'fragile' Afghanistan
text: Photo: Pablo Martinez Monsivais, AP President Barack Obama, with Joint Chiefs Chairman Gen. Joseph Dunford, left, and Defense Secretary Ash Carter, after speaking about Afghanistan, Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in the Roosevelt Room of the White House in Washington. Obama announced that he will keep U.S. troops in Afghanistan when he leaves office in 2017, casting aside his promise to end the war on his watch and instead ensuring he hands the conflict off to his successor. President Barack Obama, with Joint Chiefs Chairman Gen. Joseph... WASHINGTON (AP) — President Barack Obama announced plans Thursday to keep nearly 10,000 U.S. troops in Afghanistan through most of next year and 5,500 when he leaves office in 2017, casting aside his promise to end the war on his watch and instead ensuring he hands off the conflict to a successor. President Barack Obama, with Joint Chiefs Chairman Gen. Joseph Dunford, left, and Defense Secretary Ash Carter, after speaking about Afghanistan, Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in the Roosevelt Room of the White House in Washington. Obama announced that he will keep U.S. troops in Afghanistan when he leaves office in 2017, casting aside his promise to end the war on his watch and instead ensuring he hands the conflict off to his successor. President Barack Obama, with Joint Chiefs Chairman Gen. Joseph... WASHINGTON (AP) — President Barack Obama announced plans Thursday to keep nearly 10,000 U.S. troops in Afghanistan through most of next year and 5,500 when he leaves office in 2017, casting aside his promise to end the war on his watch and instead ensuring he hands off the conflict to a successor.
